utterances: Meanwhile, there's no wondering where independent Vermont Sen.
Bernie Sanders stands.
He spoke through a small speaker propped up on a ladder at the Warren County Democrats Summer Picnic.
(SOUNDBITE OF SPEECH)
SEN/PRES CAND BERNIE SANDERS: You are looking at a United States senator and a former congressman who voted against NAFTA, CAFTA and permanent normal trade relations with China...
(APPLAUSE)
...And is helping to lead the effort to defeat this disastrous Trans-Pacific Partnership.
And after his speech in a brief conversation with reporters, Sanders, who is running for president as a Democrat, criticized Clinton.
(SOUNDBITE OF PRESS CONFERENCE)
I am not clear nor do I believe the American people are clear as to what Secretary Clinton's position is.
In the days ahead, that question is sure to be asked again and again.
(SOUNDBITE OF PRESS CONFERENCE)
Is she for it?
Is she against it?
Those are your two options.
The president is for it.
Most Democrats in the Congress are against it.
I'm against it.
Elizabeth Warren is against it.
Sherrod Brown is against.
Almost all Democrats in the House are against it.
What is the secretary's position?
Back at Clinton's event, it wasn't clear how her new statements on trade played with the 600 or so people in the room.
One woman said it wasn't an issue she understood or was passionate about.
Mike Cossitt supported Clinton in 2008 and praised other parts of her speech before bringing up trade unprompted.
I don't understand why we need another trade agreement.
I didn't think NAFTA was a very good agreement.
That's the one thing about Bill Clinton's presidency that I did not care for.
Cossitt says he's hoping to see Sanders speak soon.
Tamara Keith, NPR News, Des Moines, Iowa.
Happy Thanksgiving, and also welcome to holiday movie season.
Boxers and animated dinosaurs are joining Katniss Everdeen and the other ""Hunger Games"" rebels at a theater near you.
And what else does Hollywood have in store this season?
Well, droids and light sabers for one thing.
NPR critic Bob Mondello serves up his selections in this end-of-year preview.
(SOUNDBITE OF SONG, ""STAR WARS MAIN THEME"")
Yeah, yeah, we'll come back to that.
Most years, there are several blockbuster wannabes for the holidays.
This year, even the superheroes have scooted out of the way of J.J.
Abrams' intergalactic juggernaut.
But that does not mean these star warriors will have the Cineplex to themselves.

They'll be joined by seafarers, stockbrokers, Shakespeareans and a small army of ""Saturday Night Live"" alumni, including Will Ferrell as a step-dad who has to compete for his step-kids' affections with their real dad, Mark Wahlberg.
In ""Daddy's Home,"" the two of them have a kind of dad-off, even during bedtime stories.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""DADDY'S HOME"")
(As Dusty) So the king raised his mighty sword.
And he rained steel down upon the step-king.
(As Brad) But the step-king blocked it with the shield.
(As Dusty) Step-king was very upset because when the real king pulled out his sword, it was long and shiny.
(As Brad) All the ladies of the land preferred the more average-sized step-king's sword because it knew how to listen.
Elsewhere, Ferrell's ""Saturday Night Live"" gal-pals Amy Poehler and Tina Fey will be plowing similar comic ground, playing siblings who want to spruce up their family home for sale in ""Sisters.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""SISTERS"")
(As Kate Ellis) We are looking for a yard artisan to do some work on our bushes.
(As Maura Ellis) I bet working on other people's bushes really makes you want to whack your weeds.
(As Kate Ellis) That was dirtier than I thought.
(As Maura Ellis) I'm sorry.
That got dirty really fast.

Other comedies include ""Christmas Eve,"" in which six groups of New Yorkers get stuck in elevators during a power outage, ""Christmas Again,"" in which a Brooklyn guy staves off holiday loneliness by selling Christmas trees, and ""The Lady In The Van,"" the true story of what happened when a homeless woman parked one day on playwright Alan Bennett's street in London.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""LADY IN THE VAN"")
(As character) Sorry, you can't park here.
(As Miss Shepherd) The Virgin Mary.
I spoke to her yesterday.
She was outside the post office.
That's Maggie Smith as the prickly Miss Shepherd, whom Bennett offered refuge in his driveway for a couple of weeks.
She stayed - and remember, this is a true story - for 15 years.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""LADY IN THE VAN"")
(As Alan Bennett) Would you like me to get you a cup of coffee?
(As Miss Shepherd) No, no. I don't want you to go to all that trouble.
I'll just have half a cup.

Other true stories are more serious than ""Lady In The Van."" ""Concussion,"" for instance, features Will Smith as the Nigerian-born doctor who saw professional athletes becoming incapacitated in their primes and thought he knew why.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""CONCUSSION"")
(As Dr. Bennet Omalu) Repetitive head trauma chokes the brain.
It turns you into someone else.
The NFL, though, didn't want to hear that.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""CONCUSSION"")
UNIDENTIFIED ACTOR #1: (As character) Tape, needles, Vicodin, Toradol, whatever it takes to keep them in the game.
It's business.
UNIDENTIFIED ACTOR #2: (As character) Get me a meeting with the commissioner.
UNIDENTIFIED ACTOR #1: (As character) They don't want to talk to you.
UNIDENTIFIED ACTOR #3: (As character) The NFL has known about the concussion issue for years.
Also making drama of a real-life scandal, ""The Big Short"" is the story of the mortgage meltdown that led up to the global economic collapse in 2008, based on a best-seller.
And featuring Christian Bale, Steve Carell and Brad Pitt, it's told from the point of view of the very few folks who saw the crash coming.
(SOUNDBITE OF FILM, ""THE BIG SHORT"")
(As Jared Vennett) No one's paying attention.
(As Mark Baum) The banks got greedy.
And we can profit off of their stupidity.
UNIDENTIFIED ACTOR #4: (As character) You want to bet against the banks?
